intro: Sida viscidula, commonly known as sticky sida, is a herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it a sticky texture. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in spikes, and it is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Sida viscidula is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Its adaptability to various environments makes it a common weed in many regions.
